monster.name: Ash Zombie
monster.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Ash Puff
trait.text: The first time the zombie takes damage, any living creature within 5 feet of the zombie must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on it early with a successful save.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: From somewhere in the darkness, a gurgling moan is heard. A form lurches into view, dragging one foot as it raises bloated arms and broken hands. The zombie advances, driven to kill anyone too slow to escape its grasp. Ash Zombies. These zombies were created by the magical devastation when Mount Hotenow erupted thirty years ago. They use the zombie stat block, with the following additional trait. Ash Puff. The first time the zombie takes damage, any living creature within 5 feet of the zombie must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on it early with a successful save. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 31

monster.name: Evil Mage

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard's spell list:
Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp
• 1st level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile
• 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step

monster.spells: light, mage hand, shocking grasp, charm person, magic missile, hold person, misty step
monster.description: Evil mages (such as Iarno Albrek and Hamun Kost) hunger for arcane power and dwell in isolated places, where they can perform terrible magical experiments without interference. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 57, The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy

monster.name: Gundren Rockseeker

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: <$title_short_name$> has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 41

monster.name: Mormesk the Wraith
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The wraith can move through an object or another creature, but can't stop there.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. If this attack reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

monster.description: A wraith is the incorporeal remnant of a particularly hateful being. Most wraiths can transform those they have slain into spectral undead servitors. Mormesk chooses not to, preferring to let the dead stay dead. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 59

monster.name: Nezznar the Black Spider

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Nezznar has a spider staff.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Nezznar has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: Nezznar has disadvantage on attack rolls when he or his target is in sunlight.

action.name: Spider Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Nezznar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire (save DC 12)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Nezznar is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). Nezznar has the following spells prepared from the wizard's spell list:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, ray of frost, shocking grasp
• 1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield
• 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, suggestion

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, mage hand, ray of frost, shocking grasp, mage armor, magic missile, shield, invisibility, suggestion
monster.description: Drow (dark elves) are a devious, scheming subterranean race that worships Lolth, the Demon Queen of Spiders. Drow society is strictly matriarchal. Male drow are relegated to servitor roles, and while most train as warriors, a few, such as Nezznar, become skilled wizards. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 59

monster.name: Redbrand Ruffian

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ruffian makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Redbrand ruffians are petty thugs and ruthless enforcers skilled at intimidation and violence. They work for money and have no scruples. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 61

monster.name: Sildar Hallwinter

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: When an attacker hits Sildar with a melee attack and Sildar can see the attacker, he can roll 1d6 and add the number rolled to his AC against the triggering attack, provided that he's wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Sildar Hallwinter is a retired soldier and sellsword who hails from the city of Neverwinter. He is a loyal member of the Lords' Alliance, a political organization that unites the various free cities and towns of the North. Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 61

monster.name: Venomfang
monster.speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Venomfang can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Venomfang makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Venomfang exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Lost Mine of Phandelver p. 63
